title: Coronation Street spoilers: David stabs and kills Josh in violent revenge?
text:
David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) was horrified when rapist Josh Tucker (Ryan Clayton) showed up in prison in Coronation Street and, with emotions running high during the coming episodes, he’s given an opportunity to exact revenge on the young man. The question is: will he take it?

David’s world came crashing down last year when he was drugged and raped by best mate Josh. With Shona’s (Julia Goulding) help, he was able to come to terms with his ordeal and, although the police were unable to prove what had happened to him, he was ultimately able to move on after ensuring that Josh never returned to the Street.

The rapist later resurfaced in prison — an incident which brought all of the traumatic memories back for David. In the coming episodes, a riot breaks out and, in an attempt to stay out of trouble, David returns to his cell.

However, during the commotion Abe drags Josh into David’s cell, and hands the young lad a pair of scissors, telling him to do whatever he wants to his rapist. The Weatherfield legends tells Abe that he wants to deal with Josh alone —but will he exact violent revenge?

Meanwhile, Shona learns of the riot via the news and is worried as a result, but David later calls her — and informs her that Josh has been stabbed, before asking her to urgently get him a lawyer.

David denies any involvement in the attack, and later swears to Shona that he had no part in it. However, matters are made complicated when Max shows Shona a video of the prison riot and, during said video, Josh can be seen collapsing from a stab wound — with David nearby.

Is David responsible for the attack on Josh?

What’s more, will Josh die as a result of his injuries?

One to watch: Monday 21st October at 8:30pm on ITV.
